intro.description:
This cheat sheet is a overview of how you can navigate through the graph browser.
This is only a guide to how to browse the graph, and how to change properties of nodes and edges. If you want to write a plugin using this framework you should read the quickstart guide.
Open a graph to get started!

item.title: Selecting nodes
item.description:
You can select a node by clicking on it. Click on the background of the graph, or on the same node to deselect it.
When a node is selected, you can navigate the graph using the keyboard:
Up/down arrows: Switch focus between the in and out edges of the selected node.
Left/right arrows: Change the focussed edge to the left/right of the current edge.
Enter: Traverse to the other side of the current selected edge.
Selecting multiple nodes
You can select the marquee tool in the left bar to select multiple nodes. You can use the ctrl key to add nodes to your current selection. Pressing right mouse button on one of the selected nodes brings up a context menu.

item.title: Zooming and Panning
item.description:
Zooming with the mouse
You can zoom in a graph using the scrollwheel on your mouse.
Zooming with the keyboard
Ctrl + +: Zoom in
Ctrl + -: Zoom out
Ctrl + 0: Zoom to default
Panning
Press space with left click on the graph, then drag to move around the graph.
Center screen on active node
Select a node, then press home to center the view on it.

item.title: Property editor
item.description:
You can open the property browser in eclipse by Window -> Show view -> General -> Properties. Select a node to see and edit its properties.
Example
Select a node, and edit its properties so that the link property is the full path to a file present in the workspace, and the linenumber property to a line number of the file. You can now double click on the node to go to that file!

item.title: Hotkey summary
item.description:
Mouse interaction
Left click: Select a node.
Space + drag the mouse: Pan around the graph.
Marquee + drag the mouse: Select all nodes within the box.
Ctrl + click: Toggle whether clicked node belongs to the selection.
Double click: Go to the source code behind the clicked node.
See also: Property editor.
Navigate the graph
Up/down: Change select mode.
Left/Right: Change selected edge.
Enter: Traverse selected edge.
Home: Focus on the current selected node.
Zooming
Ctrl + +: Zoom in.
Ctrl + -: Zoom out.
Ctrl + 0: Zoom to default.
Other hotkeys
Ctrl + D: Deselect everything.
Ctrl + R: Relayout the graph.
Ctrl + T: Open new tab containing only selected nodes.
